description: Discover the mechanism of life's diversity and adaptation.

slides.title: What is Evolution?
slides.content:
# Change Over Time üê¢

Biological evolution is the change in the characteristics of a species over several generations and relies on the process of natural selection.

It explains biodiversity and adaptation.

slides.title: Charles Darwin
slides.content:
# The Voyage of the Beagle ‚õµ

Darwin visited the Galapagos Islands.
He noticed finches had different beaks perfectly suited for their specific food source (seeds, insects, cactus).

Published *On the Origin of Species* in 1859.

slides.title: Natural Selection 1
slides.content:
# Survival of the Fittest ü¶Å

Four Principles:
1. **Variation**: Individuals differ (size, color).
2. **Heritability**: Traits are passed to offspring.
3. **Overproduction**: More born than can survive.
4. **Reproductive Advantage**: Better traits = More babies.

slides.title: Natural Selection 2
slides.content:
# Not Just Strongest üí™

"Fittest" means best adapted to the **current environment**.

Example: Peppered Moths.
- Light trees $\to$ Light moths lived.
- Soot covered trees $\to$ Dark moths lived.
Nature selected the color that hid them best.

slides.title: Evidence: Fossils
slides.content:
# Rock Records ü¶ñ

Fossils show a progression from simple to complex life.
- **Transitional Fossils**: Missing links (e.g., Archaeopteryx: Dinosaur $\to$ Bird).
- Radiometric dating tells us exactly how old they are.

slides.title: Evidence: Anatomy
slides.content:
# Shared Parts ü¶¥

- **Homologous Structures**: Same bone layout (Arm of human, wing of bat, flipper of whale) suggests common ancestor.
- **Vestigial Structures**: Useless leftovers (Human appendix, Whale hip bones).

slides.title: Evidence: Embryology
slides.content:
# Growing Up ü•ö

Embryos of different species look remarkably similar in early stages.
- Humans have gill slits and tails in the womb!
- Suggests shared evolutionary history.

slides.title: Evidence: Biochemistry
slides.content:
# The Code üß¨

- All life uses DNA and RNA.
- The genetic code is universal.
- DNA comparison detects exact relatedness (Humans and Chimps share ~98% DNA).

slides.title: Mechanisms of Evolution
slides.content:
# How it Happens ‚öôÔ∏è

Besides Natural Selection:
- **Mutation**: Creates new traits (Random).
- **Gene Flow**: Migration introduces new genes.
- **Genetic Drift**: Random chance events (Volcano kills half the island), affects small populations.

slides.title: Sexual Selection
slides.content:
# Looking Good ü¶ö

Traits that help find a mate, even if they hurt survival.
- Peacock tail: Heavy and easy to spot by tigers, but ladies love it.
- Indicates strong genes ("I can survive despite this handicap").

slides.title: Speciation
slides.content:
# New Species ü¶ï

When one population splits into two that can no longer breed together.
- **Allopatric**: Physical barrier (mountains, oceans).
- **Sympatric**: Behavioral difference (mating calls).

slides.title: Coevolution
slides.content:
# Arms Race ‚öîÔ∏è

Species evolve in response to each other.
- **Predator/Prey**: Faster cheetahs $\to$ Faster gazelles.
- **Flowers/Pollinators**: Deep flowers $\to$ Long moth tongues.

slides.title: Mechanism Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which mechanism is pure luck/random chance?

slides.title: Patterns of Evolution
slides.content:
# Directions üå≥

- **Divergent**: Common ancestor splits (Wolf $\to$ Dog/Fox).
- **Convergent**: Unrelated species develop similar traits (Shark/Dolphin/Penguin all have stream-lined bodies for water).

slides.title: Human Evolution
slides.content:
# Our Story üö∂

We are Hominids (Great Apes).
- Common ancestor with Chimps ~6-7 million years ago.
- **Australopithecus**: "Lucy" (Bipedal).
- **Homo habilis**: Tool users.
- **Homo sapiens**: Big brains, language.

slides.title: Antibiotic Resistance
slides.content:
# Evolution in Action üíä

Bacteria evolve FAST.
1. Take antibiotic.
2. Kills 99%.
3. The 1% resistant bacteria survive and multiply.
4. Antibiotic no longer works.

Real-time natural selection threatening modern medicine.

slides.title: Origin of Life
slides.content:
# Abiogenesis üß™

Life from non-life.
- **Miller-Urey Experiment**: Simulated early Earth $\to$ Created Amino Acids (building blocks of life).
- First life was likely simple RNA molecules.

slides.title: Evolution Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- **Variation + Selection = Adaptation**.
- Evidence is everywhere: Rocks, Bodies, DNA.
- We share a common ancestor with all life on Earth.
- Evolution is ongoing right now!
